caption.title: Identifying optimal body length.
caption.p: (a) (Energetic cost) / (success of female-pup pairs) ratio ( R = E/ SP) as a function of female body length, for increasing distances from colony to the resource areas. Each color represents the distance to the resource (Dist) (blue: 150 km, red: 200 km, green: 250 km, pink: 300 km, grey: 350 km, orange: 400 km). Horizontal line indicates the 95% confidence intervals obtained by the bootstrap method (1000 samples with replacements). The regression curve R = 1.792 Length 2-355.4 Length+19670 (R 2 = 0.99) is only indicative. To clarify the graph, the representation of each relation was limited to values close to the optimum. (b) Optimal E/SP ratios (MJ) as a function of Dist. (c) Distanceâ€“optimal female body length relationship. (d) SP-Optimal female body length relationship. Parameters used: Aggreg = 3, Abund = intermediate level and type of memorization = Mem1.
